comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Frederick Albert Britten (1871-1946), Republican Congressman from Illinois. He was elected to the U.S. House of Representatives for the first of 11 terms in 1912. He served from January, 1913 until January, 1935, having been defeated in his bid for a twelfth term in 1934. Fred Britten at the Biographical Directory of the U.S. Congress.
